intro: Coffea swynnertonii, commonly known as the Swynnerton's coffee, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the highlands of Ethiopia and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and white, tubular flowers. The plant produces red berries containing two seeds, which are used to make a rare type of coffee. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1.5 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
